explanation: The #else branch is under an #ifdef PACKAGE_VERSION. Given the provided project configuration where PACKAGE_VERSION is defined as "1.0.1", the preprocessor removes the #else alternative entirely and only the single-line implementation (return PACKAGE_VERSION;) is compiled. MISRA Rule 2.1 targets code that is present in the built project but cannot be reached at run time; code that is excluded by conditional compilation is not part of the translation unit and therefore not ‘‘unreachable’’ in the compiled project. If you analyze a different build configuration in which PACKAGE_VERSION is not defined then the #else branch would be compiled and used — still not unreachable. Therefore Agent A’s claim is not correct for the given project configuration.
